page.title: 08NURSING HOMES
page.content: Moredun Convent is now a private nursing home. We asked Anna MacNab, the matron, a number of questions. There used to be apple trees in the garden, but these were removed recently to make way for new houses. Thirty six people are employed in the home, many only part time, and there are 26 old people there at the moment. The nurses have a limited social life and not much leisure time. They do have hobbies and Anna's are watching T.V. and knitting. There are 34 rooms in the convent which vary in size, some singles, some doubles. Parts of the grounds are protected by the council because the trees are very old and have to be conserved. Only the younger ones are cut down.
